newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice ends near limit up on exports.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice ends near limit up on exports.

text.p: CBOT rice futures settled sharply higher after posting 30-cent-per-cwt limit gains on Thursday, propelled by surprisingly strong USDA weekly export sales data, traders said.
"Rice was limit up on much higher-than-expected exports and some commercials were caught short," said Jack Scoville, analyst with LIT America.

USDA on Thursday said weekly export sales totaled 71,700 tonnes, nearly four times more than the previous week. Key buyers were Turkey and Colombia and rough rice, the variety traded at the CBOT, comprised a large portion of the sales.
Traders said Cargill Inc was a featured buyer in the rice pit.
Volume was estimated by CBOT at 1,000 lots, well above Wednesday's actual volume of 209 lots.
Rice ended 28 to three cents per cwt higher with May up 28 at $11.72 per cwt.
